name: Lootbox Chances
description:
### Use description
You have a lootbox with N items. Each item has a different chance to drop and can be dropped only once. After each item drop chances need to be evenly redistributed

### Actual Task
The actual task is to provide a function that will distribute in equal numbers provided `chances`, and round up for the top `n` items

Function receives two arguments:
  * An array of chances
  * A chance of a dropped item that needs to be distributed
  
And should return
  * Redistribution Chances

### Example 1
When chances can be evenly distributed

Given `[20, 20, 20, 20], 20`

It should return `[25, 25, 25,25]`

### Example 2
In another case even distribution isn't possible so most probable chance become even more probable

Given `[40, 30, 15, 5], 10`

It should return `[43, 33, 17, 7]`

### Example 3

When chances are equal and can't be evenly distributed. Follow the original order of `chances` array

Given `[22, 9, 22, 22, 9, 2], 14`

It should return `[25, 11, 25, 24, 11, 4]`
